verbs.description: efflower (third-person singular simple present efflowers, present participle efflowering, simple past and past participle efflowered)

entries.meaning: (rare) To graze; (leatherworking) to remove the outer surface of (a skin) with a knife.
examples: Chamois or Shamoy leather.â€”The skins are first washed, limed, fleeced, and branned as above described. They are next efflowered, that is, deprived of their epidermis by a concave knife, blunt in its middle part, upon the convex horse-beam.
